question: 強い
sourceAnswer: strong/potent/competent/domineering/tough | strong/brawny/powerful/healthy/rugged | good-(at)/skilled/knowledgeable | being-able-to-handle/know-how-to-deal-(with)/durable-(against)/resistant-(to)/resilient | firm/rigid/solid | intense/strong/fierce/high | dependable/trustworthy
sourceMnemonic: This is a single kanji with an <ja>い</ja> on the end, meaning you know it's probably an adjective. What's the adjective form of <kanji>strong</kanji>? It's also <vocabulary>strong</vocabulary>.
sourceReadingMnemonic:
Since this word consists of a kanji with hiragana attached, you can bet that it will use the kun'yomi reading. You didn't learn that reading with this kanji, so here's a mnemonic to help you: 

So you wanna be <vocabulary>strong</vocabulary> huh? Well, all you have to do is eat these <reading>two yo</reading>gurts (<ja>つよ</ja>). One is filled with horse steroids, the other is full of bull steroids. They will make you so strong.
